In my opinion, the format of this network division exercise has many solutions. I suggest you this solution. Class B network 150.10.0.0 , It requires the creation of 4 subnets, so it is necessary to borrow 2 bits in the hostID part to make the subnetID create 4 combinations 00 01 10 11 from 2 borrowed bits, which means 2^2= 4 subnets  So . subnets 1  : 150.10.0.64      => broadcast address : 150.10.0.63 subnets 2  : 150.10.0.128   => broadcast address : 150.10.0.127 subnets 3  : 150.10.0.192   => broadcast address : 150.10.0.191 subnets 4  : 150.10.1.0        => broadcast address : 150.10.0.255 and new subnets mask : 255.255.192.0  or /(16+2) = /18
